message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.DC 

This paper deals with the design of a centralized decision-making framework for device-to-device (D2D) communication in a two-tier cellular network. The paper discusses mode selection, resource allocation, and power control for D2D communication. The paper's focus on wireless communication and network optimization suggests that it belongs to the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-category. The paper also discusses information theory and optimization techniques, which are relevant to the Information Theory (cs.IT) sub-category. The paper's emphasis on system-level design and control suggests that it belongs to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category. The paper also discusses multimedia communication, which is relevant to the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. Finally, the paper's focus on network optimization and resource allocation suggests that it belongs to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category.
